task_summary: Sequential opening of the oven door by a robotic manipulator, including perception, approach, grasp, actuation, confirmation, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: The robot is assigned to open the oven door in a kitchen setup. The oven door is located beneath the counter surface and is initially closed. The manipulator must visually find the door, precisely align, compute a pulling grasp, securely grasp the door handle or edge, pull the door open, confirm that it is opened, and then retreat from the workspace. The process avoids excessive force and ensures safety.
preconditions: Oven door is closed and within reachable workspace.
Robot arm and gripper are functional and initialized.
stepwise_plan: Compute and execute suitable grasp pose for pulling.
Grasp and verify the oven door is held.
Pull the door open by applying defined movement.
Confirm the door has opened using built-in condition.
Retreat from the oven door workspace.
success_criteria: No collision or loss of grasp during actuation.
failure_and_recovery: Failure in perceiving oven door: retry scan up to three times.
Grasp failure: re-compute and re-attempt grasp.
Door not open after pull: retry or alert for help.
Loss of object in gripper: abort and reposition.
task_long_description.termination: Task completed when oven door is open and robot is in retreat position.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if oven door is visible to camera.
Performs a line scan to locate oven door in view.
Attempts to localize oven door in workspace.
Moves end effector to door with 5mm alignment tolerance.
Computes grasp pose for pulling oven door.
Executes grasp at computed pose using pull strategy.
Checks whether the oven door is currently held by gripper.
Pulls oven door by 15cm along 90Â° direction (outward).

recovery_strategy: Scan and retry up to 3 times if not detected
Abort and request operator intervention on repeated failures
assumptions: Frames confirm oven door location and closed state; arm acts on left cabinet door with vertical handle as oven door.
Instruction matches scene; no visible handle, pull grasp inferred from arm trajectory.
No user-specified force, default ports used.
No clear indication of grasp failure, so pull assumed successful in frames.
Retreat phase evident but object/gripper interaction occludes.

expected_success_criteria: No accidental object drop or collision
